title: AutoWear
summary: Brings your Android Wear device to a whole new level. Just watch the video :)

You also need an Android Wear device. Check how here: http://goo.gl/28DScI☑ Create Screens Create your own interactive screens. Check the video and screenshots for examples☑Create NotificationsShow notifications on your wear device whenever you want, with the info you want. Best of all, most screens can be embedded in notifications!☑Floating IconsCreate icons that stay on top of everything you do so they always stay immediately accessible no matter where you are.☑Control your watchChange settings, launch apps, check your heart-rate and step count, check your watch's battery level... The possibilities are endless!☑Control your phone from your watchYou can react to watch events like plugged in to a power source, or screen on and off or even connected and disconnected from your device to automate your phone in any way you can think of☑Free TrialYou can try out the full version of AutoWear with the built-in 7 day trial. You need to sign in to Google+ to enter the trial so that it stores your trial date on Google's "Cloud Saves" server. You can just set all sharing settings to private if you're concerned about privacy when signing in :)Important Note: there is known issue on the Sony Smartwatch 3 Android 5.0 that causes battery drain and makes the shake feature not work. To avoid this, please update your Sony Smartwatch 3 to Android 5.1 and all everything will work the way it should!Important Note 2: there is known issue that the shake detection doesn't work on the Huawei watch if it's not updated. Please update it to the latest version to make the shake feature work.╭⋞⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟Disclaimer⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⋟The app unlock may not work if you have Lucky Patcher, Freedom, or possibly any other program designed to circumvent licensing protection.
descriptionHTML:
Watch the AutoWear video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wZXy7CSrXkg
Learn how to do everything in the video here: https://joaoapps.com/autowear/



As seen on
★Gizmodo: http://gizmodo.com/this-wildly-nerdy-app-gives-android-wear-watches-super-1688428322#

★Android Police: http://www.androidpolice.com/2015/02/26/autowear-android-wear-brings-power-tasker-watch/

★Life Hacker: http://lifehacker.com/autowear-brings-taskers-customized-voice-commands-to-an-1688406916

★Android Central: http://www.androidcentral.com/ac-editors-apps-week-evoland-autowear-yahoo-weather-and-more#slide3

★Android Headlines: http://androidheadlines.com/2015/02/new-tasker-plugin-called-autowear-allows-users-automate-android-wear-devices.html

★Android Authority: http://www.androidauthority.com/autowear-tasker-functionality-android-wear-590157/



╭⋞⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟IMPORTANT NOTE⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⋟
╿AutoWear is a Tasker plugin for Android Wear. You need to have Tasker (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.dinglisch.android.taskerm) installed to use many of its features, so please be aware of that before using it.
You also need an Android Wear device. It won't work on other types of smart watches
╽You can get a free trial of Tasker here: http://tasker.dinglisch.net/download.html
╰⋞⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⋟


AutoWear enables you to automate your Android Wear device in ways you never imagined





☑ Voice Commands with AutoVoice integration
You can easily bring up a voice command screen and do voice commands that are sent directly to AutoVoice




☑ Ok Google integration
Choose from a list of pre-defined voice commands that you can integrate directly with "Ok Google". Check how here: http://goo.gl/28DScI




☑ Create Screens
Create your own interactive screens. Check the video and screenshots for examples




☑Create Notifications
Show notifications on your wear device whenever you want, with the info you want. Best of all, most screens can be embedded in notifications!




☑Floating Icons
Create icons that stay on top of everything you do so they always stay immediately accessible no matter where you are.




☑Control your watch
Change settings, launch apps, check your heart-rate and step count, check your watch's battery level... The possibilities are endless!




☑Control your phone from your watch
You can react to watch events like plugged in to a power source, or screen on and off or even connected and disconnected from your device to automate your phone in any way you can think of




☑Free Trial
You can try out the full version of AutoWear with the built-in 7 day trial. You need to sign in to Google+ to enter the trial so that it stores your trial date on Google's "Cloud Saves" server. You can just set all sharing settings to private if you're concerned about privacy when signing in :)



Important Note: there is known issue on the Sony Smartwatch 3 Android 5.0 that causes battery drain and makes the shake feature not work. To avoid this, please update your Sony Smartwatch 3 to Android 5.1 and all everything will work the way it should!

Important Note 2: there is known issue that the shake detection doesn't work on the Huawei watch if it's not updated. Please update it to the latest version to make the shake feature work.


╭⋞⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟Disclaimer⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⋟
The app unlock may not work if you have Lucky Patcher, Freedom, or possibly any other program designed to circumvent licensing protection.
comments: App connects my OG Moto watch to Tasker on my phone. I use it primarily to trigger tasks on the phone but it does so much more!
This makes android wear awesome! great app, great tasker integration and even better development support.  the entire Auto Series makes Android better than the rest
Thanks for the response Dev. :) I'll be giving this a better look now as tasker has been a life save alone
Dead app, dev not updating but still wanting good ratings, disregard it  Edit: Shouldn't have been so quick to doubt Joao, he makes some of the best apps around
Got it all working yesterday, then autowear updated, now all it does is turn my watch screen off when using shake
Awesome but the latest update broke a lot of stuff for me, specially confirmation
recentChanges: - Set commands as HTTP Urls to call that URL directly from the watch
- Say text out loud on watch action
- App Icons on Watch for each of the "virtual" AutoWear apps
